rows.TAXONOMY: The complete vocabulary of the system. Every term defined. One place.

rows.col_2: The complete operating model for one business. The top-level container. Everything lives inside a Trade.
One of two files within a Trade. The Imagination Passet is the thinking. The Implementation Passet is the doing. Together they are the Trade.
rows.col_3: Levels, which contain Clusters, which contain TUPs
rows.col_4:
IonWave Imagination Passet (this file, 927 tabs)
IonWave Implementation Passet (to be built)
rows.col_5: A college within a university (College of Arts, College of Science)

rows.col_2: A major division within a Passet. Organizes TUPs by scope. Each Level is a complete system that could theoretically stand alone.
rows.col_4:
Studio Level (S0-S40)
Business Level (M0-M40)
Funnel Level (F0-F20)

rows.col_2: A group of related TUPs that are produced together and share experts, dependencies, and themes. The unit of work assignment.
rows.col_4:
BCL-3: DR & Creative (M11-M15)
SCL-1: People & Culture (S2, S6-S13)
FCL-0: Brand & Content (F0-F3, F17)

rows.col_2: A single domain model within the Trade. The fundamental unit. One TUP = one complete body of knowledge about one subject.
rows.col_4:
M13: Media Buying
S6: Recruiting Engine
F3: YouTube Playbook

rows.col_2: A single page within a TUP. The smallest unit. Contains actual content.
rows.col_4:
P-M13 (project plan for media buying)
V-M13 (verification sheet)
M13-Audiences (audience targeting spec)
rows.col_5: A lesson or assignment within a course

rows.TAXONOMY: TAB TYPES (structural tabs every TUP has)

rows.col_3: Scope, deliverables, "done" criteria, timeline, dependencies, key decisions.
Role title, equity, time commitment, deliverables, IP assignment, termination.
rows.col_5: The person being hired for this TUP

rows.col_3: Domain context, best practices, benchmarks, common pitfalls, expert concerns.
Grading rubric (A/B/C/D/F), sign-off fields, expert name, date, comments.
The actual substance of the TUP. Frameworks, specs, plans, data.
Domain (what the business needs to know)
rows.col_4: Knowledge, frameworks, strategies, specs, best practices. "Here's how media buying should work."
rows.col_5: Every V-tab is graded A or B by an expert. Nilo signs off. File locks.
rows.col_6: Becomes a textbook. Reference document. Never edited again. Implementation Passet spawns from it.

rows.col_4: Tasks, owners, deadlines, statuses, dependencies. "Week 3: open Business Manager. Owner: CoS. Status: done." Each task points back to its source TUP in the Imagination Passet.
rows.col_5: The business is running. All tasks either completed or converted to ongoing operations.
rows.col_6: Review Passet spawns quarterly. Learnings feed next Imagination Passet for next business.

rows.col_2: Produces the seed (M0, S0). Final sign-off on all V-tabs. Does not manage day-to-day.
Maintains both Passets. Distributes tabs to people. Updates master when work returns. First hire.
rows.col_3: SCL-1 (9 models) + custody of entire Trade

rows.col_2: Cold email, platform posting, screening, scheduling, entity filing support.
Interviews everyone on air. Recruiting conversations. Working conversations. Daily updates. Makes it fun.
Narrative arc. Episode planning. MC management. Production quality. Cast management.
Builds and runs the funnel level. YouTube, lead magnets, email sequences, landing pages.
Builds the site. Does not own models.
Owns a cluster. Runs it like a production. Coordinates expert. Drives milestones.
Reviews and grades models in their domain. 10-20 hours per cluster. A/B/C/D/F grading.
Runs IonWave day-to-day. Inherits the verified Trade as operating system.
rows.col_3: All M- models (41) in implementation mode

rows.col_2: TUPs being drafted by Claude, refined by PM co-founders, reviewed by experts.
rows.col_4: Nilo, Claude, librarian, PMs, experts, MC

rows.col_2: Experts grading every TUP. V-tabs being filled. A/B/C/D/F per model.
Imagination Passet is complete. All V-tabs green. File is frozen. Becomes textbook.
Tasks being executed from the Implementation Passet. The business is being built.
Quarterly look back. What worked, what didn't. Learnings captured.

rows.col_3: College of Arts (imagination) vs College of Applied Science (implementation)
Take these courses together, shared themes
One subject, one body of knowledge, one grade
A single unit of content within a course
What you'll learn, what's due, how you'll be graded
Terms, compensation, IP, what you sign
Background context before you start the work
Expert evaluates, assigns grade, signs off
Sets curriculum, final sign-off, doesn't teach
Maintains records, distributes materials, files grades
Does the work, earns the grade, graduates
Teaches domain, grades work, validates quality
Interviews everyone, makes content, makes it fun
Shapes the narrative, manages the host, quality control
Runs the funnel that recruits students into the school
Inherits the education, applies it in the real world
Apply the knowledge in real-world execution
